text: the assembly will now hear an address by
his Excellency
to Adera
head of state of the Central African
Republic I request protocol to escort
his Excellency
on behalf of the general assembly
I have the honor to welcome his
Excellency
head of state of the Central African
Republic and to invite him to address
the assembly
Mr President
of the general assembly ladies and
gentlemen
the 78th session of the general assembly
of the United Nations organization
is one I am attending
on behalf of my country the Central
African Republic
it provides me with a felicitous
opportunity
to reaffirm our staunch determination to
contribute
to the Quest for common solutions to the
challenges faced by humankind Mr
President
before
making my address by way of my country's
contribution to the general debate I
wish
from this high Rostrum of the United
Nations symbol power Excellence of human
solidarity I wish to express the
solidarity of the car people
to the brotherly peoples of Morocco and
Libya who have been devastated by
natural disasters
which have produced
colossal material damage material damage
which is incalculable indeed and have
also claimed thousands of lives this
occurred just a few days before the
opening of our session as I have
underscored on other occasions the
tragic consequences of these natural
disasters must draw the attention of the
world scientific Community to the urgent
need to pinpoint the regions of the
world which are particularly vulnerable
to extreme climate events and must
prompt them
to make available to the states
concerned the necessary information
to limit the damage caused by such
events moreover
the entire world
followed with great dismay in recent
days the arrival on mass of thousands of
African migrants to the island of
lampedusa in Italy these young people
represent the present and the future of
our content of Africa they are seeking
desperately to reach the European
continent in search of a Promised Land
this escalation of the migrant crisis is
one of the terrifying consequences of
the Looting of the natural resources
owned by the country's made poor by
slavery Colonial colonialism and Western
imperialism as well as terrorism and
internal armed conflicts these are often
waged in furtherance of geminizing
agendas and against a backdrop of
geopolitical and geostrategic tensions
between major Global powers
here I do mourn the existence
and decry the existence of this
dehumanizing phenomenon nevertheless I
hail solidarity and unprecedented
efforts deployed by host countries and
the iom to provide assistance to these
young peoples whose very lives are
imperiled by Smugglers and Lawless dream
Merchants however my country believes
that the UN must go beyond our common
commitment to revitalize Global
solidarity it must get African countries
on board in the search for Global
solutions to migrate to crises and to
the existential challenges which are
facing the young people of the African
continent Mr President
our countries continue to face
climate chaos
to whether geopolitical tensions and
face Financial challenges
as well as unprecedented energy and food
crises at this same time new challenges
are appearing day after day on the
global Horizon today in Africa as
elsewhere conflicts symptoms of
geopolitical and geostrategic tensions
that divide the major powers are plain
to see in Sudan an internal armed
conflict rare in its cruelty erupted in
April 2023 and that was at a time when
the country was well on the way to
normalization with a promising process
of dialogue underway bringing together
the nation's key players the car has
already
hosted 15
000 chadian and Sudanese refugees in the
rakagar prefecture and our people are
resilient but hosting those refugees we
means we are exposing our people to a
worsening of the humanitarian situation
and we risk seeing our security
situation worsen further still
I call upon you to take account of the
impact of this crisis and the effect
it's having on Regional geopolitics and
please show International solidarity in
favor of our refugees against the
backdrop of this session the Russian
Ukrainian conflict is continues to play
out on the ground there are no prospects
for the peaceful settlement of this
consequence and that is in spite of the
fact that the consequences of this
conflict for the world are painful and
deeply unfortunate Mr President the
persistence and increase in the number
of hotbeds of tension throughout the
world raised questions about the
effectiveness of certain mechanisms for
the prevention and peaceful settlement
of disputes that the UN has its as at
its disposal the un's primary mission is
to guarantee International Peace and
security
these question marks are why we
forcefully reaffirm the common African
position regarding Security Council
reform that position seeks to increase
the number of permanent and
non-permanent members on the council and
to Grant a permanent seat to Africa
which is the only right and just thing
to do the car believes that there is an
urgent need to provide redress for the
historical injustices done to Africa in
view of important agendas on the table
an important Summit such as the summit
of the future in 2024 and the 80th
anniversary of the United Nations in
2025 both of the above could provide
opportunities for member states to unite
and to take tangible measures to
ultimately usher in the aforementioned
reform Mr President the CR is pondering
a question and that is how can we
expedite the Fulfillment of agenda 25
to bring about peace prosperity progress
and sustainability for all
at a time when certain States wielding
all of their political economic and
Military might
continue and consistently Avail
themselves of coercive diplomacy or
instrumentalize ifis in order to impose
economic financial and trade blockades
against those countries that have been
made poor by slavery colonialized
colonialism and imperialism indeed on
the 29th of July 2023 the people of the
car learned to their great distress of
the renewal of the arms embargo
that was
brought about by trumped up reports and
allegations with spurious exemptions
provided for the National Security
forces the car
criticizes here before the world this
cynic decision the cynical decision
which betrays the unspoken intention of
the members of the council that voted
for it to instrumentalize sanction
regimes for political purposes and to
bring political pressure to bear under
the Aegis of the United Nations here I
remind you and I Rue the fact that arms
embargoes and Diamond embargoes that
have been renewed since for the last 10
years
happen in parallel with the suspension
of budgetary and economic support and
both of these factors are real obstacle
for my country's achievement of the
realization of agenda 2030. here we
repudiate this denial of our right to
self-determination and permanent
sovereignty over our wealth and natural
resources rights guaranteed by the
relevant illegal instruments of the
United Nations please
do away with these trumped-up mechanisms
which
thinly Veil a desire to allow insecurity
to Reign and to continue a strange hold
over our natural resources for the
benefit of foreign powers these
mechanisms ultimately legitimize armed
groups and give them the the status of
being a subject of international law Mr
President our planet is burning our
planet is drowning the world is
collapsing the world is crying
yes every day the media announced
natural disasters linked to climate
change which look very much like
harbingers of the Apocalypse paradoxally
trust and solidarity between the Nations
the as founding values of the United
Nations are growing ever more brittle
and that is taking the human Community
the community of mankind further and
further away from achieving Noble
sustainable development goals for the
benefit of peace prosperity progress and
sustainability for all as enshrined in
agenda 2030.
however
in order to rebuild trust and reignite
solidarity in the face of devastating
climate phenomena
commitments have been entered into by
developed nations may and major
polluters we saw that in the Paris
agreement in Glasgow and in charmel
Sheikh in Egypt cop 27 in particular was
particularly useful in setting four
major goals that we all adopted namely
mitigation adaptation financing and a
just transition in order to face up to
the common challenges of humankind
unfortunately many countries
have been the innocent victims of the
tragic consequences of the
overexploitation of our planet by
developed countries and these countries
are not seeing the fruits of financial
pledges made Mr President we are rightly
aware of the value of the contributions
made by bilateral and multilateral
partners in their desire to show
solidarity towards Africa our continent
and we thank them
for that support however we call for a
more Dynamic
Diversified and agile partnership which
respects the sovereignty of states and
the cultural and moral values of all it
is only in this way that we will be able
to reignite the flame of friendship
between peoples to promote peace and
security and to create
conditions propitious to Equitable and
inclusive development my country
continues to advocate for an inclusive
multilateralism for
accelerated expedited growth for all for
a global balanced order and we call for
Global disputes to be
solved with particular emphasis placed
on International Peace and security and
the respect of the sovereignty of each
and every state I like to Avail myself
of this opportunity to decry all the
disinformation and smear campaigns waged
by certain Western media against the cir
here I reaffirm my country's
determination to diversify its
International cooperation and extend it
to all countries who wish to cooperate
with us with the only desire of
furthering the vital interests of our
people and of avoiding competition
between Global Powers that's the
cooperation I call for Mr President on
the 30th of July we adopted the new
constitution of the cir that was adopted
by an overwhelming majority of 95.3
percent of the population there was a
turnout of over 57 percent and with that
vote the people of the car reaffirmed
its commitment to the purposes and
Prince people set forth in the United
Nations Charter they reaffirmed their
inalienable right to the respect of
their sovereignty to self-determination
to the stability of Institutions to
peace to security to National unity and
to development
two
speed up
fulfillment of agenda 2030 and its
sustainable development goals to bring
about peace prosperity progress and
sustainability for all the government
continues to implement the political
agreement for peace and Reconciliation
and we continue also to implement the
Luanda joint roadmap we are striving to
strengthen the commitment of all
stakeholders to these processes
as part of the implementation of these
agreements for peace and International
Security nine armed groups have already
been dissolved in parallel these special
criminal court and other ordinary courts
independently continue their fight
against impunity I wish to recall that
beyond the Constitution
are National policy of decentralization
is the expression of a deeply Harvard
will of the car
it is also an essential component of the
peace agreement and of the Luanda joint
roadmap I wish to hear point to all of
the efforts already undertaken by the
national electoral Authority
with the support
of international technical assistance
these efforts have allowed us to
reassess the timeline for elections now
local elections are scheduled to take
place in October 2024.
for us this is a fundamental step in our
journey towards ensuring local ownership
of democracy the promotion of
participatory governance and local
development
it is in furtherance of these goals that
we wish to have local elections which
are inclusive transparent peaceful and
credible I urge all of our partners to
support the government to ensure the
electoral process that has got off to
such a good start successfully concludes
I wish it was every success in our work
and I thank you for your kind attention
I sank on behalf of the general assembly
the head of state of the Central African
Republic for the statement just made and
our request protocol to escort his
